t: Matthew 26
The Plot to Kill Jesus
When*p Jesus had finished saying all these things, he told his disciples,
“You*r know*r that*r the*r Passover*r takes*r place*r after*r two*r days,*r and*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r be*r handed*r over*r to*r be*r crucified.”*r
Then*p the chief priests and the elders of the people assembled in the courtyard of the high priest, who was named Caiaphas,
and they conspired to arrest Jesus in a treacherous way and kill him.
“Not during the festival,” they said, “so there won’t be rioting among the people.”
The Anointing at Bethany
While*p Jesus was in Bethany at the house of Simon the leper,
a woman approached him with an alabaster jar of very expensive perfume. She poured it on his head as he was reclining at the table.
When the disciples saw it, they were indignant. “Why this waste?” they asked.
“This might have been sold for a great deal and given to the poor.”
Aware*p of this, Jesus said to them, “Why*r are*r you*r bothering*r this*r woman?*r She*r has*r done*r a*r noble*r thing*r for*r me.*r
You*r always*r have*r the*r poor*r with*r you,*r but*r you*r do*r not*r always*r have*r me.*r
By*r pouring*r this*r perfume*r on*r my*r body,*r she*r has*r prepared*r me*r for*r burial.*r
Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r wherever*r this*r gospel*r is*r proclaimed*r in*r the*r whole*r world,*r what*r she*r has*r done*r will*r also*r be*r told*r in*r memory*r of*r her.”*r
Then*p one of the Twelve, the man called Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests
and said, “What are you willing to give me if I hand him over to you?” So they weighed out thirty pieces of silver for him.
And from that time he started looking for a good opportunity to betray him.
Betrayal at the Passover
On*p the first day of Unleavened Bread the disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Where do you want us to make preparations for you to eat the Passover?”

“Go*rp into*r the*r city*r to*r a*r certain*r man,”*r he said, “and*r tell*r him,*r ‘The*r Teacher*r says:*r My*r time*r is*r near;*r I*r am*r celebrating*r the*r Passover*r at*r your*r place*r with*r my*r disciples.’”*r
So the disciples did as Jesus had directed them and prepared the Passover.
When evening came, he was reclining at the table with the Twelve.
While they were eating, he said, “Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r one*r of*r you*r will*r betray*r me.”*r
Deeply*p distressed, each one began to say to him, “Surely not I, Lord?”
He*p replied, “The*r one*r who*r dipped*r his*r hand*r with*r me*r in*r the*r bowl -*r he*r will*r betray*r me.*r

The*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r go*r just*r as*r it*r is*r written*r about*r him,*r but*r woe*r to*r that*r man*r by*r whom*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r betrayed!*r It*r would*r have*r been*r better*r for*r him*r if*r he*r had*r not*r been*r born.”*r
Judas,*p his betrayer, replied, “Surely not I, Rabbi?” “You*rp have*r said*r it,”*r he told him.
The First Lord’s Supper
As*p they were eating, Jesus took bread, blessed and broke it, gave it to the disciples, and said, “Take*r and*r eat*r it;*r this*r is*r my*r body.”*r
Then he took a cup, and after giving thanks, he gave it to them and said, “Drink*r from*r it,*r all*r of*r you.*r
For*r this*r is*r my*r blood*r of*r the*r covenant,*r which*r is*r poured*r out*r for*r many*r for*r the*r forgiveness*r of*r sins.*r

But*r I*r tell*r you,*r I*r will*r not*r drink*r from*r this*r fruit*r of*r the*r vine*r from*r now*r on*r until*r that*r day*r when*r I*r drink*r it*r new*r with*r you*r in*r my*r Father’s*r kingdom.”*r
After singing a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
Peter’s Denial Predicted

Then*p Jesus said to them, “Tonight*r all*r of*r you*r will*r fall*r away*r because*r of*r me,*r for*r it*r is*r written:*r I*irpn will*ir strike*ir the*ir shepherd,*ir and*irln the*ir sheep*ir of*ir the*ir flock*ir will*ir be*ir scattered.*ir
But*rp after*r I*r have*r risen,*r I*r will*r go*r ahead*r of*r you*r to*r Galilee.”*r
Peter*p told him, “Even if everyone falls away because of you, I will never fall away.”
“Truly*rp I*r tell*r you,”*r Jesus said to him, “tonight,*r before*r the*r rooster*r crows,*r you*r will*r deny*r me*r three*r times.”*r
“Even*p if I have to die with you,” Peter told him, “I will never deny you,” and all the disciples said the same thing.
The Prayer in the Garden
Then*p Jesus came with them to a place called Gethsemane, and he told the disciples, “Sit*r here*r while*r I*r go*r over*r there*r and*r pray.”*r
Taking along Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, he began to be sorrowful and troubled.
He said to them, “I*r am*r deeply*r grieved*r to*r the*r point*r of*r death.*r Remain*r here*r and*r stay*r awake*r with*r me.”*r
Going a little farther, he fell facedown and prayed, “My*r Father,*r if*r it*r is*r possible,*r let*r this*r cup*r pass*r from*r me.*r Yet*r not*r as*r I*r will,*r but*r as*r you*r will.”*r
Then*p he came to the disciples and found them sleeping. He asked Peter, “So,*r couldn’t*r you*r stay*r awake*r with*r me*r one*r hour?*r
Stay*r awake*r and*r pray,*r so*r that*r you*r won’t*r enter*r into*r temptation.*r The*r spirit*r is*r willing,*r but*r the*r flesh*r is*r weak.”*r
Again,*p a second time, he went away and prayed, “My*r Father,*r if*r this*r cannot*r pass*r unless*r I*r drink*r it,*r your*r will*r be*r done.”*r
And he came again and found them sleeping, because they could not keep their eyes open.
After*p leaving them, he went away again and prayed a third time, saying the same thing once more.

Then he came to the disciples and said to them, “Are*r you*r still*r sleeping*r and*r resting?*r See,*r the*r time*r is*r near.*r The*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r betrayed*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r sinners.*r
Get*r up;*r let’s*r go.*r See,*r my*r betrayer*r is*r near.”*r
Judas’s Betrayal of Jesus
While*p he was still speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, suddenly arrived. A large mob with swords and clubs was with him from the chief priests and elders of the people.
His betrayer had given them a sign: “The one I kiss, he’s the one; arrest him.”
So immediately he went up to Jesus and said, “Greetings, Rabbi!” and kissed him.
“Friend,”*rp Jesus asked him, “why*r have*r you*r come?”*r Then*p they came up, took hold of Jesus, and arrested him.
At that moment one of those with Jesus reached out his hand and drew his sword. He struck the high priest’s servant and cut off his ear.
Then*p Jesus told him, “Put*r your*r sword*r back*r in*r its*r place*r because*r all*r who*r take*r up*r the*r sword*r will*r perish*r by*r the*r sword.*r
Or*r do*r you*r think*r that*r I*r cannot*r call*r on*r my*r Father,*r and*r he*r will*r provide*r me*r here*r and*r now*r with*r more*r than*r twelve*r legions*r of*r angels?*r
How,*r then,*r would*r the*r Scriptures*r be*r fulfilled*r that*r say*r it*r must*r happen*r this*r way?”*r

At*p that time Jesus said to the crowds, “Have*r you*r come*r out*r with*r swords*r and*r clubs,*r as*r if*r I*r were*r a*r criminal,*r to*r capture*r me?*r Every*r day*r I*r used*r to*r sit,*r teaching*r in*r the*r temple,*r and*r you*r didn’t*r arrest*r me.*r
But*r all*r this*r has*r happened*r so*r that*r the*r writings*r of*r the*r prophets*r would*r be*r fulfilled.”*r Then all the disciples deserted him and ran away.
Jesus Faces the Sanhedrin
Those*p who had arrested Jesus led him away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders had convened.
Peter was following him at a distance right to the high priest’s courtyard. He went in and was sitting with the servants to see the outcome.
The*p chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for false testimony against Jesus so that they could put him to death,
but they could not find any, even though many false witnesses came forward. Finally, two who came forward
stated, “This man said, ‘I can destroy the temple of God and rebuild it in three days.’”
The*p high priest stood up and said to him, “Don’t you have an answer to what these men are testifying against you?”
But Jesus kept silent. The high priest said to him, “I charge you under oath by the living God: Tell us if you are the Messiah, the Son of God.”

“You*rp have*r said*r it,”*r Jesus told him. “But*r I*r tell*r you,*r in*r the*r future*r you*r will*r see*r the*ir Son*ir of*ir Man*ir seated*ir at*ir the*ir right*ir hand*ir of*r Power*r and*r coming*ir on*ir the*ir clouds*ir of*ir heaven.”*ir
Then*p the high priest tore his robes and said, “He has blasphemed! Why do we still need witnesses? See, now you’ve heard the blasphemy.
What is your decision?” They*p answered, “He deserves death!”
Then they spat in his face and beat him; others slapped him
and said, “Prophesy to us, Messiah! Who was it that hit you?”
Peter Denies His Lord
Now*p Peter was sitting outside in the courtyard. A servant girl approached him and said, “You were with Jesus the Galilean too.”
But*p he denied it in front of everyone: “I don’t know what you’re talking about.”
When*p he had gone out to the gateway, another woman saw him and told those who were there, “This man was with Jesus the Nazarene!”
And*p again he denied it with an oath: “I don’t know the man!”
After*p a little while those standing there approached and said to Peter, “You really are one of them, since even your accent gives you away.”
Then*p he started to curse and to swear with an oath, “I don’t know the man!” Immediately a rooster crowed,
and Peter remembered the words Jesus had spoken, “Before*r the*r rooster*r crows,*r you*r will*r deny*r me*r three*r times.”*r And he went outside and wept bitterly.
